properties.description:
AWS CloudTrail - This query identifies users authenticated through AWS Cognito attempting actions in our organization. Amazon Cognito can add user sign-up and sign-in features and control access to web and mobile applications. This could indicate identity compromise as these actions should never be seen in our organization.

Handling guidance: Any triggers of this should be treated as an incident. An non-employee actor has taken an action in our accounts. Associated cognito user pools and identity pools should be purged and locked down. Kill all sessions from the triggering role (UserIdentityArn = {TriggerRole}/CognitoIdentityCredentials).
properties.query:
//Author: Jeremy Kesterson
//Source:  NA
//Reviewer:
//Description: AWS CloudTrail - This query identifies users authentiocated through AWS Cognito attempting actions in our organization. Amazon Cognito can add user sign-up and sign-in features and control access to web and mobile applications. This could indicate identity compromise as these actions should never be seen in our organization.
//Handling guidance: Any triggers of this should be treated as an incident. An non-employee actor has taken an action in our accounts. Associated cognito user pools and identity pools should be purged and locked down. Kill all sessions from the triggering role (UserIdentityArn = {TriggerRole}/CognitoIdentityCredentials).
//
AWSCloudTrail
| where UserIdentityArn contains 'CognitoIdentityCredentials'
| join kind=inner _GetWatchlist('aws-accounts') on $left.UserIdentityAccountId == $right.accountid
| extend AccountName = name
| project
    TimeGenerated,
    AccountName,
    EventSource,
    EventName,
    UserIdentityArn,
    UserIdentityAccountId,
    ReadOnly,
    SessionIssuerUserName,
    SessionIssuerArn,
    SessionIssuerAccountId,
    ErrorCode,
    ErrorMessage,
    RequestParameters,
    ResponseElements,
    Resources
